data.quote: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
data.author: Charles R. Swindoll

data.quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
data.author: Walt Disney

data.quote: Even if you fall on your face you’re still moving forward.
data.author: Victor Kiam

data.quote: Well done is better than well said.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: It’s always too early to quit.
data.author: Norman Vincent Peale

data.quote: Leap, and the net will appear.
data.author: John Burroughs

data.quote: One finds limits by pushing them.
data.author: Herbert Simon

data.quote: The wise does at once what the fool does at last.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: Do not watch the clock. Do what it does. Keep going.
data.author: Sam Levenson

data.quote: I’ve failed over and over and over again. And that is why I succeed.
data.author: Michael Jordan

data.quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
data.author: Jim Rohn

data.quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
data.author: William James

data.quote: I’d rather attempt to do something great and fail, than to attempt nothing and succeed.
data.author: Robert H. Schuller

data.quote: Your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: There is always room at the top.
data.author: Daniel Webster

data.quote: You can’t build a reputation on what you are going to do.
data.author: Henry Ford

data.quote: Success is going from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Small deeds done are better than great deeds planned.
data.author: Peter Marshall

data.quote: When you stop chasing the wrong things you give the right things a chance to catch you.
data.author: Lolly Daskal

data.quote: You just can’t beat the person who never gives up.
data.author: Babe Ruth

data.quote: The more we do the more we can do.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
data.author: Vince Lombardi

data.quote: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
data.author: Wayne Gretzky

data.quote: Fortune sides with him who dares.
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
data.author: Wayne Gretzky

data.quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
data.author: Truman Capote

data.quote: If you are what you should be, you will set the whole world ablaze!
data.author: St. Catherine of Siena

data.quote: To live is to change, and to be perfect is to have changed often.
data.author: Bl. John Henry Newman

data.quote: He who climbs never stops going from beginning to beginning, through beginnings that have no end. He never stops desiring what he already knows.
data.author: St. Gregory of Nyssa

data.quote: Love to be real, it must cost—it must hurt—it must empty us of self.
data.author: St. Teresa of Calcutta

data.quote: Teach us to give and not count the cost.
data.author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

data.quote: I know well that the greater and more beautiful the work is, the more terrible will be the storms that rage against it.
data.author: St. Faustina

data.quote: Joy is very infectious; therefore, be always full of joy.
data.author: St. Teresa of Calcutta

data.quote: Life is pain, highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something.
data.author: William Goldman, The Princess Bride

data.quote: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
data.author: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone

data.quote: But you know, happiness can be found even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
data.author: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (movie)

data.quote: Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?
data.author: L.M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables

data.quote: I want my daughters to be beautiful, accomplished, and good. To be admired, loved, and respected. To have a happy youth, to be well and wisely married, and to lead useful, pleasant lives.
data.author: Louisa May Alcott, Little Women

data.quote: Better be happy old maids than unhappy wives.
data.author: Louisa May Alcott, Little Women

data.quote: Father and Mother guided her tenderly through the Valley of the Shadow, and gave her up to God.
data.author: Louisa May Alcott, Little Women

data.quote: There's many a worse thing than a husband.
data.author: L.M. Montgomery, Anne of Avonlea

data.quote: No, she isn't [pretty]...But you'll think she is while she's talking to you. Everybody does. It's only when you go away from her that you find out she isn't a bit pretty after all.
data.author: L.M. Montgomery, The Story Girl

data.quote: People laugh at me because I use big words. But if you have big ideas, you have to use big words to express them, haven't you?
data.author: L.M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables

data.quote: I don't want sunbursts or marble halls, I just want you.
data.author: L.M. Montgomery, Anne of the Island

data.quote: Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.
data.author: Warren Buffett

data.quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
data.author: Edith Wharton
